Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
Player.java class file. This is the class that contains the methods and fields for the players of the Pig game. Includes the required methods from the MP2 documentation sheet.
Since:
22 February 2021
Author:
Wyatt Fisher

    void reset()
    Resets the playerâ€™s turn and game scores to zero, primarily for use in starting a new game.
    int rollDice​(javax.swing.JLabel die1, javax.swing.JLabel die2)
    The rollDice method will perform the rolling of the individual die being displayed on each of the two JLabel objects; (the returned value are to be used to update the game and turn scores, as well as the status variables for the boolean-returning methods below).

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()

  • Method Details

    • rollDice

      public int rollDice​(javax.swing.JLabel die1, javax.swing.JLabel die2)
      The rollDice method will perform the rolling of the individual die being displayed on each of the two JLabel objects; (the returned value are to be used to update the game and turn scores, as well as the status variables for the boolean-returning methods below).
      Parameters:
      die1 - The JLabel for die1.
      die2 - The JLabel for die2.
      Returns:
      The sum of the die.

    • isTurnScoreLost

      public boolean isTurnScoreLost()
      Returns true if the result of the roll causes the player to lose the turn, false otherwise. If a single 1 is rolled, the score for the current turn is lost (i.e., it is set to zero) and the turn ends.
      Returns:
      True if the result of the roll causes the player to lose the turn, false otherwise.

    • isGameScoreLost

      public boolean isGameScoreLost()
      Returns true if the result of the roll causes the player to lose both the turn and all points accumulated in the game, false otherwise. If two ones are rolled, the score for the entire game is lost (i.e., it is set to zero) and the turn ends.
      Returns:
      True if the result of the roll causes the player to lose both the turn and all points accumulated in the game, false otherwise.

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      Returns true if the player has scored at least 100 points, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      True if the player has scored at least 100 points, false otherwise.

    • addTurnScoreToGameScore

      public boolean addTurnScoreToGameScore()
      This method is to be called ONLY when a player finishes his/her turn. Returns true if the value of the game score changes as a result of the operation.
      Returns:
      True if the value of the game score changes as a result of the operation.

    • getTurnScore

      public int getTurnScore()
      This returns the current turn score.
      Returns:
      Player's current turn score.

    • getGameScore

      public int getGameScore()
      This returns the player's current game score.
      Returns:
      Player's current game score.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the playerâ€™s turn and game scores to zero, primarily for use in starting a new game.

    • setName

      public void setName​(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the player's name and saves as a string.
      Parameters:
      name - The player's name.

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the player's name.
      Returns:
      The player's name.

    • getDie1Value

      public int getDie1Value()
      Returns the result of rolling die 1.
      Returns:
      The value of die 1.

    • getDie2Value

      public int getDie2Value()
      Returns the result of rolling die 2.
      Returns:
      The value of die 2.
